boat.name: Dragonfly
boat.full_description:
John and Vera Lewis bought 'Dragonfly' in Puerto Rico, 1998. After a cruise from there through all the islands down to Trinidad and Tobago, she was hauled out for the hurricane season. After relaunching in November, she cruised back to St Martin, May 1999. From there she sailed to the Azores, Falmouth and Poole, her home port.

'Dragonfly' has a royal blue hull with gold cove line, white cabin trunking and grey non slip deck paint with all exterior teak high gloss varnished. She has a traditional long keel traditional with wine glass transom upon which the rudder is mounted. Two carbon fibre white painted masts with conventional alloy booms carry fully battened main and mizzen. Her sails are hoisted, lowered or reefed from the cockpit making for safe handling of all lines.
boat.construction_details: Built of GRP using a Balsa Core method
boat.short_description: 'Dragonfly' is an American built Freedom 33 Cat Ketch built 1981 of GRP using the balsa cored method of construction making a very strong but lighter hull than solid GRP.
